title: Inviting a Friend to Do Something

content.text: In this lesson, you'll learn how to invite an Italian friend to get a coffee. We'll go step-by-step, starting with how to ask if they are free.
Remember to match the adjective to the person you're talking to. Use *libero* for a male friend and *libera* for a female friend.

data.meaning: Would you like to get a coffee?

data.phrase: Che giorno va bene per te?
data.meaning: What day is good for you?

data.tip: The 'gi' sound is like the 'j' in 'jeep'.

content.title: Making an Invitation
content.setting: You want to invite your friend, Giulia, to get coffee.

conversation_flow.title: Ask Giulia if she is busy at the moment

extract_info.friend_name: Extract the friend's name from the initial greeting

conversation_flow.title: Ask which day would be good for her
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Sì, è una buona idea! Certo.

content.text: Great start! Now let's propose a specific day and time. In Italian, you use 'alle' for time, like 'alle tre' (at three).

data.tip: The stress is on the final syllable: mer-co-le-DÌ.

content.text: In Italy, 'un bar' is a café where people get coffee, pastries, and snacks. It's not usually a place for just alcoholic drinks.

content.title: Setting a Time and Place
content.setting: Giulia is free to meet. Now you need to agree on a time and place.

conversation_flow.title: Propose meeting on Wednesday at 3 o'clock
React positively to her confirmation
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Mercoledì alle tre è perfetto per me. Dove?

conversation_flow.title: Suggest a café in the city center

content.text: Excellent! You've made a plan. Now, let's learn how to confirm the details and say goodbye.

data.tip: Pronounce the double 'l' by holding the 'l' sound for a moment longer than usual.

data.meaning: See you then / See you later

content.title: Confirming the Plan
content.setting: You've agreed on the main details. Now, confirm everything with Giulia and end the conversation.

conversation_flow.title: Summarize the plan: Wednesday at three at a café in the center
Say that you are looking forward to it
